metadata.title: CVE-2020-8492 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Python 2.7 through 2.7.17, 3.5 through 3.5.9, 3.6 through 3.6.10, 3.7through 3.7.6, and 3.8 through 3.8.1 allows an HTTP server to conductRegular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attacks against a clientbecause of urllib.request.AbstractBasicAuthHandler catastrophicbacktracking.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.18-1~20.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
libpython3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
python3.8 - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
python3.8-examples - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
python3.8-venv - 3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.18-1~20.04.1').
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.2-1ubuntu1.1').
